docs.snippet: Louie Psihoyos and the others behind "The Cove," a nominee for best feature-length documentary, have been very open about the various marketing tactics they have used to get people to see it....
docs.lead_paragraph: Another film that could benefit from the buzz of its Oscar nomination is "The Cove," about a secret dolphin slaughter in Japan. The documentary has struggled with a reputation that its subject matter is difficult to stomach, which its makers refute.
docs.abstract: Louie Psihoyos and the others behind "The Cove," a nominee for best feature-length documentary, have been very open about the various marketing tactics they have used to get people to see it.

docs.snippet: The folks behind "The Hurt Locker" are appealing the academy's rule that only three producers can be listed for a best picture nominee....
docs.lead_paragraph: When "The Hurt Locker" was nominated as one of the 10 best movies on Tuesday morning, there were no names attached to receive the kudos officially. Greg Shapiro, one of four producers of the film, told the Bagger that his team was appealing the Academy's rule that only three people may take proper credit. The other producers are Kathryn Bigelow, the director and a nominee; Mark Boal, the screenwriter and a nominee; and Nicolas Chartier, the financier.
docs.abstract: The folks behind "The Hurt Locker" are appealing the academy's rule that only three producers can be listed for a best picture nominee.

docs.snippet: Lawrence Bender,the producer of "Inglourious Basterds," was at the conference promoting a documentary he made about nuclear disarmament when he heard about the best picture nomination....
docs.lead_paragraph: Apocryphal history and bombastic entertainment are strange bedfellows, as Quentin Tarantino showed in "Inglourious Basterds," but not as strange, perhaps, as the twin interests of Lawrence Bender, a producer of that movie. Mr. Bender was in Paris at a nuclear disarmament conference when he heard the news that "Basterds" had nabbed eight Oscar nominations, via a phone call from his mom.
docs.abstract: Lawrence Bender,the producer of "Inglourious Basterds," was at the conference promoting a documentary he made about nuclear disarmament when he heard about the best picture nomination.

docs.snippet: Three of today's best actresses, all first-time Oscar nominees, share their reactions of when they heard the news....
docs.lead_paragraph: While the Bagger blogs away in Los Angeles, the Baguette has been working the phones in New York. Here are how some of today's best actresses, all first-time nominees, reacted when they heard the Oscar news:
docs.abstract: Three of today's best actresses, all first-time Oscar nominees, share their reactions of when they heard the news.

docs.lead_paragraph: I remain skeptical of the Academy Awards' decision to expand the Best Picture pool to 10, but this year's list makes the decision look like a qualified success. Without the expansion, it's probably safe to assume that the roster of nominees would have consisted of "Avatar," "Up in the Air," "Inglourious Basterds," "The Hurt Locker" and "Precious." That means the additions are "An Education," "District 9," "Up," "A Serious Man," and "The Blind Side." The first four are solid or even inspired choices, and if - as people seem to think - the alternative to "The Blind Side" was "Invictus," then I'm glad the Academy went with Sandra Bullock's hit instead.

docs.snippet: Tom Bernard, co-president of Sony Pictures Classics, was cheered by the performance of the indie world in Tuesday's Oscar nominations....
docs.lead_paragraph: A day after Sony Pictures Entertainment announced another round of layoffs, its indie division, Sony Pictures Classics, earned a company record of 13 Oscar nominations for seven films on Tuesday, including "An Education," "The Last Station," "The White Ribbon," "Coco Before Chanel" and "The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus." (The latter two were nominated in categories like costumes and art direction.)
docs.abstract: Tom Bernard, co-president of Sony Pictures Classics, was cheered by the performance of the indie world in Tuesday's Oscar nominations.
